intro: Scabiosa praemontana, commonly known as the alpine scabious, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its delicate, lace-like foliage and clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It is a member of the Caprifoliaceae family, which includes other flowering plants with similar structural features. Scabiosa praemontana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting pollinators.
